DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type related to the specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, radiation therapy (treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation) being given.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, radiation therapy (treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation) being given.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to NRG for by script Fri Jan 24 11:30:54 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type related to the specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, radiation therapy (treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation) being given.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary, robotic radiosurgery system designed to deliver precise beams of high does radiation to tumors with extreme accuracy.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary, robotic radiosurgery system designed to deliver precise beams of high dose radiation to tumors with extreme accuracy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation of protons during radioactive decay.

Concepts.definition: Radiation of protons during radioactive decay.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A machine that creates high-energy radiation to treat cancer, using electricity to form a stream of fast-moving subatomic particles.  Also called mega-voltage (MeV) linear accelerator or a linac.

Concepts.definition: A type of particle accelerator that generates ionizing radiation by colliding subatomic particles traveling at high speeds along a straight chamber. This creates high-energy radiation that may be used to treat cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

Concepts.definition: An advanced form of 3-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy (3D CRT) that involves the use of varying intensities of small radiation beams to produce dosage distributions that are more precise than those possible with 3D CRT.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

Concepts.definition: A process by which a dose of radiation is automatically shaped to closely conform to the entire volume of the tumor, so that surrounding normal tissue is spared and treatment toxicity is decreased.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
